intro: Hemizonia leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Hemizonia leucocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
